Interanterodorsal nucleus of the thalamu.EditorialNote: Not sure whether this is equivalent to the massa intermedia.  Needs review.
Interanterodorsal nucleus of the thalamu.Definition: a group of nerve cells that bridges the midline of the thalamus between the anterodorsal nucleus of the thalamus of the left and right sides. According to Crosby (1962), it is more developed and consistently present in rodents than in primates (adapted from Brain Info).
